org.gbif.common.messaging

Class DefaultMessagePublisher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gbif.common.messaging.DefaultMessagePublisher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessagePublisher

    @ThreadSafe
public class DefaultMessagePublisher
extends Object
implements MessagePublisher
    This class can be used to publish messages easily.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DefaultMessagePublisher(ConnectionParameters connectionParameters)
      Convenience constructor that uses a default ObjectMapper and the DefaultMessageRegistry.
      DefaultMessagePublisher(ConnectionParameters connectionParameters, MessageRegistry registry, org.codehaus.jackson.map.ObjectMapper mapper)
      Builds a new MessagingService with the provided components, and declares all the necessary exchanges as topic based.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Does nothing.
      void send(Message message)
      Sends a message to the default exchange for this message and uses the routing key calculated from the message.
      void send(Message message, String exchange)
      Sends a message to the given exchange using the routing key calculated from the message.
      void send(Object message, String exchange, String routingKey)
      Sends a message to the given exchange with the given routing key.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • send

        public void send(Object message,
        String exchange,
        String routingKey)
          throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: MessagePublisher
        Sends a message to the given exchange with the given routing key. Tries to reuse a channel and only opens a new one if the old one was closed.
        Specified by:
        send in interface MessagePublisher
        Parameters:
        message - to send. This is being converted into JSON using Jackson
        exchange - to publish to
        routingKey - to use
